info.title: MyGene.info API
info.description: Documentation of the MyGene.info Gene Query web services. Learn more about [MyGene.info](http://mygene.info/)

tags.name: metadata
tags.description: Metadata about the data available from MyGene.info.

get.description: Make gene query and return matching gene list. Support JSONP and CORS as well.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Query string. Examples "CDK2", "NM_052827", "204639_at". The detailed query syntax can be found at http://docs.mygene.info/en/latest/doc/query_service.html

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated field to limit the fields returned from the matching gene hits. The supported field names can be found from any gene object (e.g. http://mygene.info/v2/gene/1017). Note that it supports dot notation as well, e.g., you can pass "refseq.rna". If "fields=all", all available fields will be returned. Default "symbol,name,taxid,entrezgene,ensemblgene".

parameters.name: species
parameters.description: can be used to limit the gene hits from given species. You can use "common names" for nine common species (human, mouse, rat, fruitfly, nematode, zebrafish, thale-cress, frog and pig). All other species, you can provide their taxonomy ids. Multiple species can be passed using comma as a separator. Passing “all” will query against all available species. Default human,mouse,rat.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: the maximum number of matching gene hits to return (with a cap of 1000 at the moment). Default 10.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: the number of matching gene hits to skip, starting from 0. Combining with "size" parameter, this can be useful for paging. Default 0.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: comma-separated fields to sort on. Prefix with "-" for descending order, otherwise in ascending order. Sort by matching scores in decending order.

parameters.name: facets
parameters.description: a single field or comma-separated fields to return facets, for example, “facets=taxid”, “facets=taxid,type_of_gene”.

parameters.name: species_facet_filter
parameters.description: relevant when faceting on species (i.e., “facets=taxid” are passed). It’s used to pass species filter without changing the scope of faceting, so that the returned facet counts won’t change. Either species name or taxonomy id can be used, just like “species” parameter above.

parameters.name: entrezonly
parameters.description: when passed as “true” or “1”, the query returns only the hits with valid Entrez gene ids. Default: false

parameters.name: ensemblonly
parameters.description: when passed as “true” or “1”, the query returns only the hits with valid Ensembl gene ids. Default: false.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: you can pass a "callback" parameter to make a JSONP call.

parameters.name: dotfield
parameters.description: control the format of the returned fields when passed "fields" parameter contains dot notation, e.g. "fields=refseq.rna". If "true" or "1", the returned data object contains a single "refseq.rna" field, otherwise ("false" or "0"), a single "refseq" field with a sub-field of "rna". Default: true

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: alias for "fields" parameter.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: alias for "size" parameter.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: alias for "from" parameter.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: If you are regular users of our services, we encourage you to provide us an email, so that we can better track the usage or follow up with you.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: multiple query terms seperated by comma (also support "+" or white space), but no wildcard, e.g., "q=1017,1018" or "q=CDK2+BTK"

parameters.name: scopes
parameters.description: specify one or more fields (separated by comma) as the search "scopes", e.g., "scopes=entrezgene", "scopes=entrezgene,ensemblgene". The available "fields" can be passed to "scopes" parameter are listed at http://mygene.info/doc/query_service.html#available-fields. Default "scopes=entrezgene,ensemblgene,retired" (either Entrez or Ensembl gene ids).

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: a comma-separated fields to limit the fields returned from the matching gene hits. The supported field names can be found from any gene object (e.g. http://mygene.info/v2/gene/1017). Note that it supports dot notation as well, e.g., you can pass "refseq.rna". If "fields=all", all available fields will be returned. Default "symbol,name,taxid,entrezgene,ensemblgene".

parameters.name: species
parameters.description: can be used to limit the gene hits from given species. You can use "common names" for nine common species (human, mouse, rat, fruitfly, nematode, zebrafish, thale-cress, frog and pig). All other species, you can provide their taxonomy ids. Multiple species can be passed using comma as a separator. Default human,mouse,rat.

parameters.name: dotfield
parameters.description: control the format of the returned fields when passed "fields" parameter contains dot notation, e.g. "fields=refseq.rna". If "true" or "1", the returned data object contains a single "refseq.rna" field, otherwise ("false" or "0"), a single "refseq" field with a sub-field of "rna". Default true.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: If you are regular users of our services, we encourage you to provide us an email, so that we can better track the usage or follow up with you.

get.description:
Retrieve gene annotation based on Entrez or Ensembl gene id, support
JSONP and CORS as well.

parameters.name: geneid
parameters.description: Entrez or Ensembl gene id, e.g., 1017, ENSG00000170248. A retired Entrez Gene id works too if it is replaced by a new one, e.g., 245794

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: a comma-separated fields to limit the fields returned from the matching gene hits. The supported field names can be found from any gene object (e.g. http://mygene.info/v2/gene/1017). Note that it supports dot notation as well, e.g., you can pass "refseq.rna". If "fields=all", all available fields will be returned. Default "symbol,name,taxid,entrezgene,ensemblgene".

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: you can pass a "callback" parameter to make a JSONP call.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: alias for "fields" parameter.

parameters.name: dotfield
parameters.description: control the format of the returned fields when passed "fields" parameter contains dot notation, e.g. "fields=refseq.rna". If "true" or "1", the returned data object contains a single "refseq.rna" field, otherwise ("false" or "0"), a single "refseq" field with a sub-field of "rna". Default true.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: If you are regular users of our services, we encourage you to provide us an email, so that we can better track the usage or follow up with you.

post.description: Make gene queries in batch for a list of Entrez or Ensembl gene ids.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: multiple geneids seperated by comma, e.g., "ids=1017,1018" or "ids=695,ENSG00000123374". Note that currently we only take the input ids up to 1000 maximum, the rest will be omitted.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: a comma-separated fields to limit the fields returned from the matching gene hits. The supported field names can be found from any gene object (e.g. http://mygene.info/v2/gene/1017). Note that it supports dot notation as well, e.g., you can pass "refseq.rna". If "fields=all", all available fields will be returned. Default "symbol,name,taxid,entrezgene,ensemblgene".

parameters.name: species
parameters.description: Optional, can be used to limit the gene hits from given species. You can use "common names" for nine common species (human, mouse, rat, fruitfly, nematode, zebrafish, thale-cress, frog and pig). All other species, you can provide their taxonomy ids. Multiple species can be passed using comma as a separator. Default all.

parameters.name: dotfield
parameters.description: control the format of the returned fields when passed "fields" parameter contains dot notation, e.g. "fields=refseq.rna". If "true" or "1", the returned data object contains a single "refseq.rna" field, otherwise ("false" or "0"), a single "refseq" field with a sub-field of "rna". Default true.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: If you are regular users of our services, we encourage you to provide us an email, so that we can better track the usage or follow up with you.

get.description: Get metadata about the data available from MyGene.info

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: you can pass a "callback" parameter to make a JSONP call.
